CONTENTS.P: Project Name: Communal Infrastructure Program (CIP) II, Phase 3 – Armenia, Water and Sanitation
Project Ref-No: BMZ 2013 6634.3 & BMZ 2009 66 515
Tender Title: Lot-1: – Rehabilitation of Water Supply Network and Sewer Systems in the Shirak Water and Sewerage Service Area
Prequalification No.: CIP-II-P3-SH-PQ
Deadline 8.6.2018
Communal infrastructure program (CIP) II, Phase 3 — Armenia, water and sanitation
Name of PEA: The Government of the Republic of Armenia through the “Water sector projects implementation unit SA” (WSPIU),

The Government of the Republic of Armenia through the “Water sector projects implementation unit SA” (WSPIU), hereinafter referred to as “the PEA”, has received a loan from KfW and the European investment bank — EIB (hereinafter referred to as “the Financing institutions”) towards the cost of the “Communal infrastructure II, Phase 3 – Armenia, water and sanitation, Lot-1: – Rehabilitation of water supply network and sewer systems in the Shirak water and sewerage service area”, hereinafter referred to as “the project”. This international invitation for prequalification relates to the following future construction contracts:
Lot-1: – Rehabilitation of water supply network and sewer systems in the Shirak water and sewerage service area

The applicable procurement rules will be in accordance with the latest version of the KfW “Guidelines for procurement of goods, works and associated services in Financial cooperation with Partner countries“(please refer to homepage of KfW development bank www.kfw.de). It is planned to award the construction contracts to contractors experienced in the construction and rehabilitation of water, wastewater and hydro technical structures. The construction contracts will be based on FIDIC MDB Harmonised conditions of contract for construction (KfW amended version).
Requested services:
Construction and commissioning of the following infrastructure components in the a.m. Regions:
Within the Gyumri Urban Area
— Approximately 115 km of water distribution pipelines (HDPE) ranging from 90 to 315mm external diameter,
— approximately 3500 new house service connections, including new service pipes (approximately 25km total length),
— New valves, chambers and pipework to 3 existing service reservoirs,
— Replacement of valves and pipework in 4 existing small reservoir / break pressure tanks,
— works to decommission the existing water distribution network;,
— five water distribution pipe river crossing,
— Approximately 6500m of replacement sewerage (150 to 500mm diameter).
Within the Shirak Villages
Works are located within 9 villages in the Shirak area (a further five villages are optional),
— 83 km of water distribution pipelines (HDPE) ranging from 63 to 225mm external diameter,
— approximately 2400 new house service connections, including new service pipes,
— water distribution pipe river crossings,
— Rehabilitation works to an existing service reservoir.
The works contracts are expected to be implemented from March 2019 to March 2021, with 1 year for defects notification.
The eligibility and qualification criteria to be used in the pre-qualification evaluation are:
— No Conflict of interest,
— KfW bank eligibility,
— No pending litigation,
— Financial capability,
— Average annual construction turnover,
— General construction experience,
— Specific construction and contract management experience.
The criteria to be used in the tender evaluation of pre-qualified companies are continued eligibility and price only. Only pre-qualified firms will be invited to participate in the tenders.

Companies with qualified personnel, appropriate facilities and experience in the execution of comparable projects may request additional information to prepare pre-qualification documents for either 1, 2 or all 3 of the above contract for the above works. Pre-qualification documents will be available in both English and Armenian language at the address below, and are free of charge for electronic copies. The documents must be printed and completed and submitted in English language.

All short-listed companies will be invited to submit bids for all contracts. Pre-qualification documents will be distributed electronically only (by e-mail). No liability will be accepted for loss or late delivery.

Further information is available in the Pre-qualification Documents which will be distributed electronically upon written request from 4th May 2018. Full pre-qualification documents must be submitted no later than 12:00 (midday) Armenian time on 8.6.2018.

Applications for obtaining pre-qualification documents must be submitted not later than 10 days before the submission deadline. All enquiries relating to the prequalification documentation must be submitted to the following address:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.ORGANISATION: Water Sector Project Implementation Unit SA

CONTENTS.P: The construction contracts will be signed by the authorized representative of the Employer.
Copies of enquiries should also be sent to the following address:
GITEC-IGIP GmbH / HGSN Ltd.
16 Kievian st, Yerevan 0028, Armenia
Contact person: Mr. Mark Whippey – Overall Project Manager
Email: shirak@armenia.gitec-consult.com
